benefits.title: Limited cognitive benefits in Stage +2 postmenopausal women after 6 weeks of treatment with Ginkgo biloba
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba treatment showed limited cognitive benefits after 6 weeks, with only significant effects on mental flexibility in postmenopausal women with poorer performance.

benefits.title: The effects of Ginkgo biloba on metabolic syndrome: A review.
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba has weight loss effects, antidiabetic, antihypertensive, and antilipidemic properties, potentially improving metabolic syndrome components.

benefits.title: Ginkgo biloba
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba may benefit people with early stage Alzheimer's disease and multi-infarct dementia, potentially being as helpful as prescription drug therapy.

benefits.title: Tailor-Made Deep Eutectic Solvents for Simultaneous Extraction of Five Aromatic Acids from Ginkgo biloba Leaves
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba leaves have various health benefits due to the presence of bioactive compounds like polyprenyl acetates, flavonoids, and terpene trilactones.

benefits.title: Ginkgo biloba extract protects against alcohol‐induced liver injury in rats
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba extract protects against alcohol-induced liver injury in rats.

benefits.title: That Was the Year That Was: An Evidence‐Based Clinical Geriatrics Update 2002–03
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba at 120 mg/d for 6 weeks provided no measurable benefit in cognitive function to cognitively intact elders.
benefits.journal: Journal of the American Geriatrics Society

benefits.title: Cardiovascular Activity of Ginkgo biloba—An Insight from Healthy Subjects
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba improves perfusion in different vascular beds without significantly affecting blood pressure and heart rate, and positively impacts cardiovascular physiology.

benefits.title: Bioactive compounds and functional properties of Ginkgo biloba and Cola extracts
benefits.summary: Ginkgo biloba extract has been employed in the treatment of various diseases, especially for its benefits in neurodegenerative disorders and vascular microcirculation.

benefits.title: Ginkgo Biloba, a famous living fossil tree and an ancient herbal traditional Chinese medicine
benefits.summary: Ginkgo Biloba extracts have antidiabetic, antioxidant, anticancer, antihypertensive, immunestimulative, hepato-protective, and antimicrobial activities, as well as memory enhancement efficiency and beneficial effects against neurodegenerative diseases.

benefits.title: Multifaceted therapeutic benefits of Ginkgo biloba L.: chemistry, efficacy, safety, and uses.
benefits.summary: Ginkgo leaf extract has neuroprotective, anticancer, cardioprotective, stress alleviating, and memory enhancing effects, and may be promising for treatment of certain conditions.

side effects.title: Ginkgo biloba
side effects.summary: Side effects of Ginkgo biloba may include headache, nausea, gastrointestinal upset, diarrhea, dizziness, or allergic skin reactions.

side effects.title: Multifaceted therapeutic benefits of Ginkgo biloba L.: chemistry, efficacy, safety, and uses.
side effects.summary: Ginkgo leaf extract is relatively safe for consumption, but side effects include intracerebral hemorrhage, gastrointestinal disturbances, headaches, dizziness, and allergic skin reactions.

side effects.title: Inhibition of Paclitaxel Metabolism In Vitro in Human Hepatocytes by Ginkgo biloba Preparations
side effects.summary: Ginkgo biloba's concomitant use with paclitaxel could result in elevated blood levels of the chemotherapeutic, exacerbating cognitive impairment and other toxic effects associated with cancer therapy.

side effects.title: Ginkgo biloba for antidepressant-induced sexual dysfunction.
side effects.summary: Common side effects of ginkgo biloba include gastrointestinal disturbances, headache, and general central nervous system activation.

side effects.title: The main active constituents and detoxification process of Ginkgo biloba seeds and their potential use in functional health foods
side effects.summary: G. biloba seeds have been used in traditional Chinese medicine to treat asthma, cough, enuresis, pyogenic skin infections, and intestinal tract worm infections.
side effects.journal: Journal of Food Composition and Analysis

side effects.title: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome with Ginkgo Biloba
side effects.summary: Gingko biloba side effects include headaches, stomach upset, bleeding complications, dermatitis, and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS).

side effects.title: Ginkgo biloba Effects on Mice Fetal Liver
side effects.summary: Ginkgo biloba can cause congestion, fatty change, and dilatation of sinusoids in fetal liver in a dose-dependent manner.

side effects.title: The use of the Ginkgo Biloba plant and its interaction with other drugs
side effects.summary: Ginkgo biloba combined with anticonvulsants may decrease their action and intensify side effects like headache, tremors, and maniac outbreak.
side effects.journal: Proceedings of MOL2NET 2018, International Conference on Multidisciplinary Sciences, 4th edition

side effects.title: Ginkgo Biloba
side effects.summary: Ginkgo biloba may have a potential proarrhythmic side-effect, as it was associated with a significant ventricular ectopic burden in a 63-year-old man.

side effects.title: Ginkgo biloba and cerebral bleeding: a case report and critical review.
side effects.summary: Ginkgo biloba has been associated with serious bleeding complications, especially intracranial hemorrhage.

dosage.title: Ginkgo biloba for cerebral insufficiency.
dosage.summary: In most trials, the dosage was 120 mg Ginkgo extract a day, given for at least 4-6 weeks.

dosage.title: Cognitive psychophysiology in nootropic drug research: effects of Ginkgo biloba on event-related potentials (P300) in age-associated memory impairment.
dosage.summary: A daily dosage of 3 x 40 mg Ginkobene was used in the study.

dosage.title: [Effect of Coenzyme Q10 and Ginkgo biloba on warfarin dosage in patients on long-term warfarin treatment. A randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled cross-over trial].
dosage.summary: Ginkgo biloba dosage in the study was 100 mg daily.

dosage.title: Comparison of Two Dosages of Ginkgo biloba Extract EGb 761 in Patients with Peripheral Arterial Occlusive Disease Fontaine’s Stage IIb
dosage.summary: Both 120 mg and 240 mg daily dosages of Ginkgo biloba extract led to a clinically relevant improvement in pain-free walking distance after 24 weeks of treatment.

dosage.title: [Evidence for a therapeutic effect of Ginkgo biloba special extract. Meta-analysis of 11 clinical studies in patients with cerebrovascular insufficiency in old age].
dosage.summary: Ginkgo biloba special extract LI 1370 (Kaveri forte) showed therapeutic effectiveness in reducing single symptoms and total score of clinical symptoms compared to placebo.

dosage.title: Study on Effects of Ginkgo Biloba Extract on Vasodilative Factors in Hepatopulmonary Syndrome in Rats
dosage.summary: Ginkgo biloba extract at high dosage can reduce the levels of ET-1, NO, and CGRP in plasma, serum, liver, and lung tissues in Hepatopulmonary Syndrome rats.
dosage.journal: Chinese Archives of Traditional Chinese Medicine

dosage.title: Three Month Subacute Toxicity Study of Ginkgo Biloba Extract(EGb 761) in Rabbits
dosage.summary: Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb 761) dosages tested in this study were 7.5 mg/kg/day, 15 mg/kg/day, and 30 mg/kg/day.

dosage.title: Subacute Toxicity Study of Enalapril and Ginkgo biloba Extract [EGb 761] Combinations in Mice
dosage.summary: The dosages of Ginkgo biloba extract (EGb 761) in this study were 3+9mg/kg/day for low dosage, 10+30mg/kg/day for middle dosage, and 30+90mg/kg/day for high dosage.

dosage.title: Ginkgo biloba for antidepressant-induced sexual dysfunction.
dosage.summary: Dosages of ginkgo biloba extract ranged from 60 mg qd to 120 mg bid (average = 209mg/d).

dosage.title: Dosage dependence of the effect of Ginkgo biloba on the rat retinal ganglion cell survival after optic nerve crush
dosage.summary: Intragastral applications of a G. biloba extract at 0.25%, 1%, or 4% concentration were associated with a higher survival rate of retinal ganglion cells in a dosage-dependent manner.
